												Man i have 200+ hours on the other STALKERs and am a strong supporter of the series, i do have to say this was a bit of a let down, I anticipated it though which is why i bought this last.--------------------------To start off I download complete mod every stalker i buy to rid bugs and such, but even that wasnt enough for this game.I tried sooo hard to like it i really did, but its basically an addon to shadow of chernobyl with a few added locations.First thing i realized was how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ the faction battle feature was done, I just killed like 12 bandits with some stalkers wasnt too difficult had to use a few bandages but thats ab it, then literally 5 minutes later as im on the way to save another group of whiny stalkers asses, i get called back to the camp i just ♥♥♥♥ing ridded of bandits, and this happened alot until i left the swamp area its rather annoying especially when all i had was a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ shotgun and a broken AK.This only escalated as i got to the next area ''the cordon'' the starting area from the first game, as i was assuming it looked the exact same but with military running around the whole ♥♥♥♥ing place. Military is the 2nd hardest faction in ALL stalker games next to monolith, and they got me out here fighting 16 of these ♥♥♥♥ers not including the dickwads thatll show up after i leave. It wouldnt be so bad if i didnt have to fight them so early, and maybe if they didnt eat more rounds then the player and have godlike aim 24/7. I mean even the other stalkers got ♥♥♥♥ed, they on the radio calling for help and 10 seconds later they are begging me to hurry up because they have two men left, obviously by the time im there all my stalker buddies are dead besides maybe one guy on the floor begging for me to end his misery, And i cant even help him because they managed to take out 1/16 hostiles, so i mean obviously i left him there.Then after i run away the people on the radio start talking ♥♥♥♥ to me for not helping.What happened to yall saying ''Remember stalker dont be a hero'' in the begginning of the game?They should be happy i dont kill them all, because ive used half of my bandages to heal wounds that they caused due to their complete disregard of my life, I mean they look like battle droids in firefights they wont let anything even the mutant horde sneaking up on them stop them from killing the guy who shot them.And the AI straight up will rush your ♥♥♥ call of duty style with no regard for there own life breaks the immersion entirely, especially when its military and even when they were dumb for rushing they still penetrate you in your no no regions.This game has hardly any mods to make it a tolerable experience aswell because not alot of mod creators would spend there time saving clear sky.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Anyways my rant will end here, I will try my hardest to beat the game because the story is the only thing keeping my hope alive at this point, like i said i enjoy the stalker series alot, and i spent my money so i will try to make the best.But please PLEASE dont make this your first STALKER game, sure its cheap, but theres a reason for that.I Would highly recommend you play the other 2 first, before you set your mind on buying this.*Note* Before anyone thinks im being too harsh or i simply suck at the game, ive played both games thoroughly beating them both a few times on different difficulties, i know how to survive the zone.This isnt the zone, this is chernobyl with a bunch of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s terrorizing and running amok the place and im supposed to somehow complete the main quest while being called back and fourth between camps. Maybe in 3 years ill rewrite this review when i finally found the button to tell my stalker buddies theyre on their own because im walking around with one ♥♥♥♥ing arm slowly bleeding out with a ♥♥♥♥ing mob of bloodsuckers watching over me waiting for their next meal.

ber 17, 2015
												Im big on Clear Sky as some are critical of it. Dont get it twisted this game is TOUGH AS NAILS, you will die..over and over, not knowing how or why, grenade spam is REAL, Enemies bullets defy gravity and do matrix stuff to find you. If you play on veteran or master then you will break a computer component in frustration. you think dark souls is tough..Souls games cant hold a candle to this game especially. But yet i loved ever tortorous moment because i finished it. Also i havent played Call of Pripyat yet but played and completed Stalker Shadow of Chernobly and loved it..even though i didnt play it till mid 2015. But Clear Sky is every bit of enjoyable with that sense of Immersion that a post apocalyptic game really can give you. Sound effects are gnarly, the added elements and different characters (well not design wise) and there personalities. Dangerous.. check, Immersive.. Check, great visuals with the dynamic lighting (if your rig supports).. Check, sound effects make your skin crawl...Check.All the while if you play the first one you get to revisit these places but the this game clear sky is set a few years before Shadow of Chernobly. Its great to see how the Zone has changed from game to game..remebering where dangerous spots were before might not be there in the other game. Love the Plot that the Zone (which is where the melt down occured) is living and breathing and has its own life force..how theres different factions fighting among each other over beliefs of the Zone, like some want to research it others want to kill everything in it. Hippies peace and love Yin Yang stuff..i finished game in 70 hours..death total...220. its BRUTALGreat game 9/10

content:
1, 2015
												Ok so this is my first S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game and I have to say I LOVE IT. I almost didn't get it however, because of video reviews on youtube. They were all pretty negative but I have to strongly disagree with them and say I'm super glad that I got it. Now here are two things that I have seen so far to be common negatives in reviews but I haven't seen in game:- I have not been sniped with a pistol.- I can easily avoid grenades. (I use easily lightly. I just mean they're not like tactical nukes)I am, by the way, using no mods. Don't get me wrong though, this game is extremely difficult. Especially if you have no idea what your doing and die from radiation without noticing it and making the same mistake... again.. and again. But to me this makes this game beautiful. It's a harsh world that you just get thrown into. If you save a lot (and I mean A LOT), you should be fine and get a hang of the game pretty quickly without too much frustration.  Another thing I will address is that some people have a problem with the shooting mechanic. I have heard that it's really just rolling the dice. Now I know this sounds bad, I thought it did, but when I actually played, I realized it wasn't as bad as it was said to be. You are going to miss, but this just adds to the realism. And the AI aren't that bad either. The worst I've seen so far is a soldier still firing his gun after all the enemies were killed, which, by my standards, isn't anything incredibly bad. They are kinda tactical and are good to fight alongside. Now, on the line of atmosphere. IT IS PHENOMENAL. Keep in mind I don't use any mods, so this game is just made this well! Speaking mostly from the swamps, the atmosphere is pretty engaging. From the AIs all moving around and communicating within a real time world to the footsteps you can hear in the bushes alongside the path (I'm not kidding. It's creepy), this atmosphere really plays out the situation well and keeps you engaged. So if you take anything from this review, just know that your opinion is probably different from another review, so if you're even thinking about getting it.. get it. Trust me it's worth it. DARK SOULS + FALLOUT = S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 8/8 m8 would stalk her again

												When I say that I recommend this game, I do so with caution. This is not a game for everyone. If you like immersive survival post-apocalyptic games, then Clear Sky is for you. This world sucks you in with awesome sound design and a dark foreboding atmosphere. Then it smacks you in the *cough cough* with its tough enemies and dangerous environments, which adds to the tension. Not much happens when you walk around, but when something does happen it happens big. This serves to make every event feel like a life and death situation. This game is hard, but very enjoyable if you go in with the right mindset. Don't play it like Metro 2033 unless you want to end up as a new floor decoration. Hide, take cover, and fight from a distance.

content:
, 2015
												Stalker Clear Sky, like its predecessor Shadow of Chernobyl, is a post-apocalyptic survival-horror shooter taking place in the Zone of Exclusion around Chernobyl. Now, unlike its predecessor, Clear Sky has added certain new features that enhance the gameplay, such as the Factions War. In the game, multiple factions are vying for control of the Zone, and your character can join a group and help them secure the Zone, bringing in wealth, but also making new enemies, so choose wisely. Furthermore, the ability to repair and upgrade weapons and armor is now available to the player, allowing you to alter your equipment to best suit your play style. However, the story is quite frankly not as good as Shadow of Chernobyls, in my opinion. It lacks the intensity and depth that Shadow of Chernobyl has. I played this game with the Clear Sky Complete mod, which again fixes numerous bugs and noticeably improves graphics. All that in mind, this is a fantastic shooter, with several new features that set it apart from the original, although it doesn't quite measure up to the original in terms of atmosphere and story. Overall Score: 9.5/10

content:
r 10, 2016
												Had a blast playing this game! If you've played the first game of the series, Shadows of Chernobyl (SoC)—this second installation is a prequal—you'll find lots of similarities, but a few distinct differences. Gone are the moments of terror and tension of "stalking" through radiation- and anomaly-infested facilities wondering in fear of what may be around the corner. You still do a lot of it—the game world is near identical to the original SoC; however, this time the pace is much more action-oriented. A new "faction" mode compels you to spend a lot of your time fending off other humans (bandtis, renegades, military, etc...) in a "capture-the-flag" type game mode, so a lot of time is spent fending off enemies in weapon-to-weapon situations. If you're a fan of the horror motif of SoC, it's been toned down quite a bit, but if you enjoy working with very intelligent AI to take control of key positions, then you'll find that aspect of the game very engaging.The upgrade mechanic is also a welcomed mechanic; however, it was frustrating at first using low-end base weapons and watching them miss their mark more often than not. Cost of upgrades were also a little pricey, forcing you to choose very carefully or run the risk of spending additional hours grinding to make enough money to craft a new weapon to your liking.Overall, definitely worthy of the series, albeit a slightly differenty type of game than the original, but the differences were definitely more of a positive than a negative. Would definitely recommend this game, even if you've never played SoC (but I would recommend playing SoC first, as their are some major spoilers right away that reference aspects of that first game).Now I'm looking forward to finishing off the trilogy with Call of Pripyat!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
er 10, 2016
												Both S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow of Chernobyl and Call of Pripyat (which I purchased on disc upon release) were great gaming experiences. While not quite on par with Fallout 3's more detailed open world that is rich with quests, however, the STALKER franchise nevertheless offers a dark, gritty alternative for dystopian dreamers. By now, it has achieved something of a cult status amongst gamer circles. Clear Sky is a bold yet flawed attempt at portraying a prequel to Shadow of Chernobyl's storyline. This time, the player takes the role of Scar - a mercenary currently employed by the titular Clear Sky faction. During the adventure, it's possible for Scar to form allegiances with a few other factions such as Duty and Freedom. But Clear Sky was the only new offering thrown into an all-too familiar mix, the rest was old ground previously covered in SOC. It's possible to complete side missions on behalf of friendly/netural factions, yet sadly these often had glitchy and absurd times in which to complete, such as defending a camp against mutants or bandits. Often I'd barely received such a request before the annoying 'Task Failed' popped up ten seconds later! The combat aspect of STALKER is commendable, yet in Clear Sky I felt that the developers had raised the difficulty bar that bit too high. COS was challenging, yet this I found just too damn frustrating. I'm a seasoned shooter but really struggled all the way to the bitter end. If it's a mistake I've made then fair enough, but when enemies are deadly accurate, magically shoot through objects, survive bullets at point blank, and can 'sense' when I'm trying to heal then it's no longer enjoyable. Word of warning: stock up on med-kits and bandages! The final battle in pursuit of my target could only be described as a brutal experience. The AI can be a cruel companion in Clear Sky. What's worse, there's no way to lower difficulty to a more tolerable level.  As in SOC, Clear Sky boasted some fantastic firearms which worked well enough, yet it would have been nice to introduce a few extra goodies to play with - and there's whole arsenal of real world machine guns and pistols around to draw inspiration from. Again, Clear Sky fell flat by refusing to explore fresh ground in the armanents section. Perhaps even different types of grenade would have been fun?  As before, weapons deteriorate and jam over time, so it's wise to visit a technician to repair or even upgrade weapons and armour. Technicians were introduced in Clear Sky and, providing they have the money, players are now able to improve and/or modifiy equipment to their own preference. This welcome gem of gameplay was brought over to the more successful Call of Pripyat. Certain missions involve retrieving upgrade plans which can be implented later. STALKER: Clear Sky boasts some superb maps detailing varied terrain: swamps, forest, grassland, deserted villages. For a certain amount money Scar can employ the services of a guide (a sort of fast-travel option) to save on gameplay time. I can't remember if there were any new anomalies, but overall certainly not so frequent as in SOC, and therefore resulting artifacts are few and far between. In SOC I enjoyed artifact hunting and selling them for huge amounts of cash, so I keenly felt their lacking during Clear Sky. In one sense, I understand the developers were attempting to cap repetitive ease of investment and have the player keep their money in reserve for repairs and such. But I'm sure purchases in Clear Sky were much more expensive than in SOC.  Having said that, the 'food' aspect was never once observed (rarely so in SOC) and merely rendered pointless. Something that Fallout: New Vegas hardcore mode harshly yet satisfyingly implemented. It's a shame STALKER didn't take the hunger element seriously.Overall, I consider this a very average FPS lacking the character and charm of SOC or COP (the latter was released sometime later). STALKER Clear Sky is often regarded as a flawed part of the franchise without anything much new to contribute. The main storyline is not as engaging when compared to its bigger brothers, and what's annoying it really should have been an excitable sibling.

content:

												The first Swamps level is probably the best thing about Clear Sky -- it really does feel like it is building on Shadow of Chernobyl to greater heights! Unfortunately, it builds the game up to a level it cannot sustain.It's kind of cool to revist a lot of the same places and see them in a slightly different light. But by the time you are going through the Agroprom and Yantar, the novelty begins to wear off.Add in the numerous bugs and outright crashes towards the end of the game, even with the Complete mod, and I was seriously getting frustrated towards the end of my 150-hour playthrough. Oh, and the final act feels rushed, just like it did in SoC. And don't even get me STARTED on the final level! Argh!Still, the nod to the film Stalker in the penultimate level is very nice, though it is a shame the game rushes you through it without too much chance to revel in the environments.Overall -- definitely weaker and less polished that SoC Complete, but still, I managed to clock up a good amount of hours out of Clear Sky. It never quite manages to surpass its opening, though, which is a shame.

												A mix of Call of Pripyat and Shadow of Chernobyl, it implements many mechanics of the former, with the areas of the latter.  Set 2 years before ShoC, it tells the story of a mercenary with amnesia and the unnatural ability to survive emissions.I would recommend to play this game third, AFTER Call of Pripyat.  The reason being is that many of the areas are recycled from ShoC, but many of the newer, less frustrating mechanics are still in place, such as weapon modding and artifact collecting, which is one of my favorite pasttimes.Unfortuantely, there's not a whole lot of mods that add a lot of content, but if you want to play with the most stuff I'd recommend the Clear Sky Modpack 2012, which adds armor, weapons, and other crap.  Clear Skies is GOING to be released, and probably very good, but it's not done.It's sad, that it's actually my favorite of the three, because it retains the elements from CoP that I liked, with the areas that grown familiar to me from ShoC.

												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky, is the prequel to S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, a first-person shooter survival horror video game with RPG elements by Ukrainian developer GSC Game World. The game consists of a roughly 50/50 mix of new areas and old, remodeled areas from the previous game. The X-ray graphics engine has been updated to version 1.5 and includes DirectX 10 support . Additionally, the AI received an overhaul to accommodate the new faction wars feature.

er 27, 2015
												I found this game to be incredibly immersive... For the first 3 hours or so. I died within 30 seconds the first few attampts at the game. At first this was a challenge, then I learned the system, realized the game mechanics are weak and that the game became pointless.1) I'm tired of my character stopping to pant and be out of breath after a 100 yard walk. Takes him 30 seconds to be out of breath and 30 seconds to regain it. Sprint is basically pointless as you must rest as much as you move.  2) I'm tired of the terrible loot system and the terrible fps physics -- forced to pick up trash loot before I can even see real loot (which further intensifies the 1st issue). The npcs have 100% accuracy on Normal difficulty, but I can't even consistently--at any distance point-blank, MR, or long range - with a rifle while 1 tapping. 3) I'm tired of fighting the same 3 enemy NPC's over and over - bandit, pig beast, dog beast - Only to receive the same bits of loot - pistol, sawed-off, hunting rifle (actually, it's a shotgun, but who's paying attention, right?), bandage, 1st aid kit, ammo. Pig and Dog never drop loot. Bandit drops loot I already have (x100) and over-encumbers me4) Everything worth getting to requires taking the long route to avoid radiation. This is obviously annoying as the loot, stamina, and sprint functions are broke

content:
ry 20, 2016
												-gameplay and content: The atmosphere is awesome and incredible.however KI is sometimes dumb and sometimes frankly unfair (enemy grenades fly far and very precisely, hitting you an any angle as long as you are within the ridiculous range. oh and by the way, you cannot throw as far as the enemy nor with such precision). some characters also like to run at each other forever due to collision and pathfinding issues and sometimes they get stuck at doors etc. they also like to block you due to the same reasons.weapon-safezones: at the HQ of every faction and important person you can not draw your weapon. this takes a lot from the freedom feeling the game normally creates. Supposedly it is to protect the important characters but I say there is no need for it. First, linearity sux anyway and you should have the freedom to mess up the story as you want (there should be alternative solutions anyway). Second, coincidentally at these locations are some stashes which must be broken open for items, so you just don't get them. Third, if you happen to wage war with this faction, it sometimes still blocks your weapon, which means you cannot defend yourself. I say no to this kindergarten.the faction war is beside the main quest the only other chain of connected quests. it is advised not to join a faction too early in order not to lose access to some characters, traders and quests. The fight also continues after you completely destroy the enemy as the reinforcements will steadily (and a bit too frequently imo) reconquer their base.after entering limansk you will not be able to go back to explore so save before it. such a shame for a rich open world full of secrets.speaking of secrets: the scavanging and explorative aspect of the game are very interesting but are undermined by the fact that the hidden stashes (except normal stashes) are empty as long as you didn't recover any information about them from an enemy corpse or a broker. thus venturing into dangerous places sometimes has no rewards whatsoever for you if you didn't unlock them.the number of quests, both unique and repeatable are far too low for such a rich universe.just as the number of unique characters or dialogues. unfortunately the number of artifacts is fixed and no new appear. dungeons: basically there is only one dungeon in the game which is really underwhelming. _______________________________________________________-engine: somewhat clumsy and clunky when it comes to object collision. if you have bad luck some items will fall in places where you just cannot pick them... I also enjoyed climbing things like a tree in order to get a secret... NOT. it is also very unhandy that every other person in the game is considered a solid unmovable object for you which can however push you by just walking on you, thus characters sometimes block entrances to buildings etc-graphics: still not bad. surely it's not crysis or something, but still enjoyable.-main story: unfortunately you have no alternative endings and no way to change the main story. the finale is also somewhat unspectacular and boring. the "boss fight" is nothing innovative/not enjoyable. -afterplay: once again you have no ability to discover the world after the main story ends, such a shame for such an open world game. also after entering limansk there is no going back.-bugs: no significant bugs were detected. once the game crashed and the last save file became corrupted, so frequent saving with several alternating files is advised.
